trans-unit.source: Sets a two-dimensional linear transformation between world space and page space for the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: Sets a two-dimensional linear transformation between world space and page space for the specified device context

target.mrk: Sets a two-dimensional linear transformation between world space and page space for the specified device context

trans-unit.source: $tagXFORM structure that contains the transformation data.

seg-source.mrk: $tagXFORM structure that contains the transformation data.

target.mrk: $tagXFORM structure that contains the transformation data.

trans-unit.source: The _WinAPI_SetWorldTransform() will fail unless the graphics mode for the given device context has been set

seg-source.mrk: The _WinAPI_SetWorldTransform() will fail unless the graphics mode for the given device context has been set

target.mrk: The _WinAPI_SetWorldTransform() will fail unless the graphics mode for the given device context has been set

trans-unit.source: to $GM_ADVANCED by previously calling the _WinAPI_SetGraphicsMode(). Likewise, it will not be possible to reset

seg-source.mrk: Likewise, it will not be possible to reset

target.mrk: Likewise, it will not be possible to reset

trans-unit.source: the graphics mode for the device context to the default $GM_COMPATIBLE mode, unless the world transformation

seg-source.mrk: the graphics mode for the device context to the default $GM_COMPATIBLE mode, unless the world transformation

target.mrk: the graphics mode for the device context to the default $GM_COMPATIBLE mode, unless the world transformation

trans-unit.source: has first been reset to the default identity transformation by calling _WinAPI_SetWorldTransform().

seg-source.mrk: has first been reset to the default identity transformation by calling _WinAPI_SetWorldTransform().

target.mrk: has first been reset to the default identity transformation by calling _WinAPI_SetWorldTransform().

trans-unit.source: For any coordinates (x, y) in world space, the transformed coordinates in page space (x', y') can be

seg-source.mrk: For any coordinates (x, y) in world space, the transformed coordinates in page space (x', y') can be

target.mrk: For any coordinates (x, y) in world space, the transformed coordinates in page space (x', y') can be

trans-unit.source: x' = x * eM11 + y * eM21 + eDx

seg-source.mrk: x' = x * eM11 + y * eM21 + eDx

target.mrk: x' = x * eM11 + y * eM21 + eDx

trans-unit.source: y' = x * eM12 + y * eM22 + eDy

seg-source.mrk: y' = x * eM12 + y * eM22 + eDy

target.mrk: y' = x * eM12 + y * eM22 + eDy
